005package edu.wpi.first.math.estimator;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.math.MatBuilder;
008import edu.wpi.first.math.Matrix;
009import edu.wpi.first.math.Nat;
010import edu.wpi.first.math.StateSpaceUtil;
011import edu.wpi.first.math.VecBuilder;
012import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Pose2d;
013import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Rotation2d;
014import edu.wpi.first.math.interpolation.TimeInterpolatableBuffer;
015import edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.DifferentialDriveWheelSpeeds;
016import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N1;
017import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N3;
018import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N5;
019import edu.wpi.first.util.WPIUtilJNI;
020import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
021
022/**
023 * This class wraps an {@link edu.wpi.first.math.estimator.UnscentedKalmanFilter Unscented Kalman
024 * Filter} to fuse latency-compensated vision measurements with differential drive encoder
025 * measurements. It will correct for noisy vision measurements and encoder drift. It is intended to
026 * be an easy drop-in for {@link edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.DifferentialDriveOdometry}; in fact,
027 * if you never call {@link DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator#addVisionMeasurement} and only call
028 * {@link DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator#update} then this will behave exactly the same as
029 * DifferentialDriveOdometry.
030 *
031 * <p>{@link DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator#update} should be called every robot loop (if your robot
032 * loops are faster than the default then you should change the {@link
033 * DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator#DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator(Rotation2d, Pose2d, Matrix, Matrix,
034 * Matrix, double) nominal delta time}.) {@link DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator#addVisionMeasurement}
035 * can be called as infrequently as you want; if you never call it then this class will behave
036 * exactly like regular encoder odometry.
037 *
038 * <p>The state-space system used internally has the following states (x), inputs (u), and outputs
039 * (y):
040 *
041 * <p><strong> x = [x, y, theta, dist_l, dist_r]ᵀ </strong> in the field coordinate system
042 * containing x position, y position, heading, left encoder distance, and right encoder distance.
043 *
044 * <p><strong> u = [v_x, v_y, omega]ᵀ </strong> containing x velocity, y velocity, and angular rate
045 * in the field coordinate system.
046 *
047 * <p>NB: Using velocities make things considerably easier, because it means that teams don't have
048 * to worry about getting an accurate model. Basically, we suspect that it's easier for teams to get
049 * good encoder data than it is for them to perform system identification well enough to get a good
050 * model.
051 *
052 * <p><strong> y = [x, y, theta]ᵀ </strong> from vision containing x position, y position, and
053 * heading; or <strong>y = [dist_l, dist_r, theta] </strong> containing left encoder position, right
054 * encoder position, and gyro heading.
055 */
056public class DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator {
057  final UnscentedKalmanFilter<N5, N3, N3> m_observer; // Package-private to allow for unit testing
058  private final BiConsumer<Matrix<N3, N1>, Matrix<N3, N1>> m_visionCorrect;
059  private final TimeInterpolatableBuffer<Pose2d> m_poseBuffer;
060
061  private final double m_nominalDt; // Seconds
062  private double m_prevTimeSeconds = -1.0;
063
064  private Rotation2d m_gyroOffset;
065  private Rotation2d m_previousAngle;
066
067  private Matrix<N3, N3> m_visionContR;
068
069  /**
070   * Constructs a DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator.
071   *
072   * @param gyroAngle The current gyro angle.
073   * @param initialPoseMeters The starting pose estimate.
074   * @param stateStdDevs Standard deviations of model states. Increase these numbers to trust your
075   *     model's state estimates less. This matrix is in the form [x, y, theta, dist_l, dist_r]ᵀ,
076   *     with units in meters and radians.
077   * @param localMeasurementStdDevs Standard deviations of the encoder and gyro measurements.
078   *     Increase these numbers to trust sensor readings from encoders and gyros less. This matrix
079   *     is in the form [dist_l, dist_r, theta]ᵀ, with units in meters and radians.
080   * @param visionMeasurementStdDevs Standard deviations of the vision measurements. Increase these
081   *     numbers to trust global measurements from vision less. This matrix is in the form [x, y,
082   *     theta]ᵀ, with units in meters and radians.
083   */
084  public DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator(
085      Rotation2d gyroAngle,
086      Pose2d initialPoseMeters,
087      Matrix<N5, N1> stateStdDevs,
088      Matrix<N3, N1> localMeasurementStdDevs,
089      Matrix<N3, N1> visionMeasurementStdDevs) {
090    this(
091        gyroAngle,
092        initialPoseMeters,
093        stateStdDevs,
094        localMeasurementStdDevs,
095        visionMeasurementStdDevs,
096        0.02);
097  }
098
099  /**
100   * Constructs a DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator.
101   *
102   * @param gyroAngle The current gyro angle.
103   * @param initialPoseMeters The starting pose estimate.
104   * @param stateStdDevs Standard deviations of model states. Increase these numbers to trust your
105   *     model's state estimates less. This matrix is in the form [x, y, theta, dist_l, dist_r]ᵀ,
106   *     with units in meters and radians.
107   * @param localMeasurementStdDevs Standard deviations of the encoder and gyro measurements.
108   *     Increase these numbers to trust sensor readings from encoders and gyros less. This matrix
109   *     is in the form [dist_l, dist_r, theta]ᵀ, with units in meters and radians.
110   * @param visionMeasurementStdDevs Standard deviations of the vision measurements. Increase these
111   *     numbers to trust global measurements from vision less. This matrix is in the form [x, y,
112   *     theta]ᵀ, with units in meters and radians.
113   * @param nominalDtSeconds The time in seconds between each robot loop.
114   */
115  public DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator(
116      Rotation2d gyroAngle,
117      Pose2d initialPoseMeters,
118      Matrix<N5, N1> stateStdDevs,
119      Matrix<N3, N1> localMeasurementStdDevs,
120      Matrix<N3, N1> visionMeasurementStdDevs,
121      double nominalDtSeconds) {
122    m_nominalDt = nominalDtSeconds;
123
124    m_observer =
125        new UnscentedKalmanFilter<>(
126            Nat.N5(),
127            Nat.N3(),
128            this::f,
129            (x, u) -> VecBuilder.fill(x.get(3, 0), x.get(4, 0), x.get(2, 0)),
130            stateStdDevs,
131            localMeasurementStdDevs,
132            AngleStatistics.angleMean(2),
133            AngleStatistics.angleMean(2),
134            AngleStatistics.angleResidual(2),
135            AngleStatistics.angleResidual(2),
136            AngleStatistics.angleAdd(2),
137            m_nominalDt);
138    m_poseBuffer = TimeInterpolatableBuffer.createBuffer(1.5);
139
140    // Initialize vision R
141    setVisionMeasurementStdDevs(visionMeasurementStdDevs);
142
143    m_visionCorrect =
144        (u, y) ->
145            m_observer.correct(
146                Nat.N3(),
147                u,
148                y,
149                (x, u1) -> new Matrix<>(x.getStorage().extractMatrix(0, 3, 0, 1)),
150                m_visionContR,
151                AngleStatistics.angleMean(2),
152                AngleStatistics.angleResidual(2),
153                AngleStatistics.angleResidual(2),
154                AngleStatistics.angleAdd(2));
155
156    m_gyroOffset = initialPoseMeters.getRotation().minus(gyroAngle);
157    m_previousAngle = initialPoseMeters.getRotation();
158    m_observer.setXhat(fillStateVector(initialPoseMeters, 0.0, 0.0));
159  }
160
161  /**
162   * Sets the pose estimator's trust of global measurements. This might be used to change trust in
163   * vision measurements after the autonomous period, or to change trust as distance to a vision
164   * target increases.
165   *
166   * @param visionMeasurementStdDevs Standard deviations of the vision measurements. Increase these
167   *     numbers to trust global measurements from vision less. This matrix is in the form [x, y,
168   *     theta]ᵀ, with units in meters and radians.
169   */
170  public void setVisionMeasurementStdDevs(Matrix<N3, N1> visionMeasurementStdDevs) {
171    m_visionContR = StateSpaceUtil.makeCovarianceMatrix(Nat.N3(), visionMeasurementStdDevs);
172  }
173
174  private Matrix<N5, N1> f(Matrix<N5, N1> x, Matrix<N3, N1> u) {
175    // Apply a rotation matrix. Note that we do *not* add x--Runge-Kutta does that for us.
176    var theta = x.get(2, 0);
177    var toFieldRotation =
178        new MatBuilder<>(Nat.N5(), Nat.N5())
179            .fill(
180                Math.cos(theta),
181                -Math.sin(theta),
182                0,
183                0,
184                0,
185                Math.sin(theta),
186                Math.cos(theta),
187                0,
188                0,
189                0,
190                0,
191                0,
192                1,
193                0,
194                0,
195                0,
196                0,
197                0,
198                1,
199                0,
200                0,
201                0,
202                0,
203                0,
204                1);
205    return toFieldRotation.times(
206        VecBuilder.fill(u.get(0, 0), u.get(1, 0), u.get(2, 0), u.get(0, 0), u.get(1, 0)));
207  }
208
209  /**
210   * Resets the robot's position on the field.
211   *
212   * <p>You NEED to reset your encoders (to zero) when calling this method.
213   *
214   * <p>The gyroscope angle does not need to be reset here on the user's robot code. The library
215   * automatically takes care of offsetting the gyro angle.
216   *
217   * @param poseMeters The position on the field that your robot is at.
218   * @param gyroAngle The angle reported by the gyroscope.
219   */
220  public void resetPosition(Pose2d poseMeters, Rotation2d gyroAngle) {
221    // Reset state estimate and error covariance
222    m_observer.reset();
223    m_poseBuffer.clear();
224
225    m_observer.setXhat(fillStateVector(poseMeters, 0.0, 0.0));
226
227    m_prevTimeSeconds = -1;
228
229    m_gyroOffset = getEstimatedPosition().getRotation().minus(gyroAngle);
230    m_previousAngle = poseMeters.getRotation();
231  }
232
233  /**
234   * Gets the pose of the robot at the current time as estimated by the Unscented Kalman Filter.
235   *
236   * @return The estimated robot pose in meters.
237   */
238  public Pose2d getEstimatedPosition() {
239    return new Pose2d(
240        m_observer.getXhat(0), m_observer.getXhat(1), new Rotation2d(m_observer.getXhat(2)));
241  }
242
243  /**
244   * Add a vision measurement to the Unscented Kalman Filter. This will correct the odometry pose
245   * estimate while still accounting for measurement noise.
246   *
247   * <p>This method can be called as infrequently as you want, as long as you are calling {@link
248   * DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator#update} every loop.
249   *
250   * <p>To promote stability of the pose estimate and make it robust to bad vision data, we
251   * recommend only adding vision measurements that are already within one meter or so of the
252   * current pose estimate.
253   *
254   * @param visionRobotPoseMeters The pose of the robot as measured by the vision camera.
255   * @param timestampSeconds The timestamp of the vision measurement in seconds. Note that if you
256   *     don't use your own time source by calling {@link
257   *     DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator#updateWithTime} then you must use a timestamp with an epoch
258   *     since FPGA startup (i.e. the epoch of this timestamp is the same epoch as
259   *     Timer.getFPGATimestamp.) This means that you should use Timer.getFPGATimestamp as your time
260   *     source in this case.
261   */
262  public void addVisionMeasurement(Pose2d visionRobotPoseMeters, double timestampSeconds) {
263    var sample = m_poseBuffer.getSample(timestampSeconds);
264    if (sample.isPresent()) {
265      m_visionCorrect.accept(
266          new MatBuilder<>(Nat.N3(), Nat.N1()).fill(0.0, 0.0, 0.0),
267          StateSpaceUtil.poseTo3dVector(
268              getEstimatedPosition().transformBy(visionRobotPoseMeters.minus(sample.get()))));
269    }
270  }
271
272  /**
273   * Add a vision measurement to the Unscented Kalman Filter. This will correct the odometry pose
274   * estimate while still accounting for measurement noise.
275   *
276   * <p>This method can be called as infrequently as you want, as long as you are calling {@link
277   * DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator#update} every loop.
278   *
279   * <p>To promote stability of the pose estimate and make it robust to bad vision data, we
280   * recommend only adding vision measurements that are already within one meter or so of the
281   * current pose estimate.
282   *
283   * <p>Note that the vision measurement standard deviations passed into this method will continue
284   * to apply to future measurements until a subsequent call to {@link
285   * DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator#setVisionMeasurementStdDevs(Matrix)} or this method.
286   *
287   * @param visionRobotPoseMeters The pose of the robot as measured by the vision camera.
288   * @param timestampSeconds The timestamp of the vision measurement in seconds. Note that if you
289   *     don't use your own time source by calling {@link
290   *     DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator#updateWithTime} then you must use a timestamp with an epoch
291   *     since FPGA startup (i.e. the epoch of this timestamp is the same epoch as
292   *     Timer.getFPGATimestamp.) This means that you should use Timer.getFPGATimestamp as your time
293   *     source in this case.
294   * @param visionMeasurementStdDevs Standard deviations of the vision measurements. Increase these
295   *     numbers to trust global measurements from vision less. This matrix is in the form [x, y,
296   *     theta]ᵀ, with units in meters and radians.
297   */
298  public void addVisionMeasurement(
299      Pose2d visionRobotPoseMeters,
300      double timestampSeconds,
301      Matrix<N3, N1> visionMeasurementStdDevs) {
302    setVisionMeasurementStdDevs(visionMeasurementStdDevs);
303    addVisionMeasurement(visionRobotPoseMeters, timestampSeconds);
304  }
305
306  /**
307   * Updates the the Unscented Kalman Filter using only wheel encoder information. Note that this
308   * should be called every loop.
309   *
310   * @param gyroAngle The current gyro angle.
311   * @param wheelVelocitiesMetersPerSecond The velocities of the wheels in meters per second.
312   * @param distanceLeftMeters The total distance travelled by the left wheel in meters since the
313   *     last time you called {@link DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator#resetPosition}.
314   * @param distanceRightMeters The total distance travelled by the right wheel in meters since the
315   *     last time you called {@link DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator#resetPosition}.
316   * @return The estimated pose of the robot in meters.
317   */
318  public Pose2d update(
319      Rotation2d gyroAngle,
320      DifferentialDriveWheelSpeeds wheelVelocitiesMetersPerSecond,
321      double distanceLeftMeters,
322      double distanceRightMeters) {
323    return updateWithTime(
324        WPIUtilJNI.now() * 1.0e-6,
325        gyroAngle,
326        wheelVelocitiesMetersPerSecond,
327        distanceLeftMeters,
328        distanceRightMeters);
329  }
330
331  /**
332   * Updates the the Unscented Kalman Filter using only wheel encoder information. Note that this
333   * should be called every loop.
334   *
335   * @param currentTimeSeconds Time at which this method was called, in seconds.
336   * @param gyroAngle The current gyro angle.
337   * @param wheelVelocitiesMetersPerSecond The velocities of the wheels in meters per second.
338   * @param distanceLeftMeters The total distance travelled by the left wheel in meters since the
339   *     last time you called {@link DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator#resetPosition}.
340   * @param distanceRightMeters The total distance travelled by the right wheel in meters since the
341   *     last time you called {@link DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator#resetPosition}.
342   * @return The estimated pose of the robot in meters.
343   */
344  public Pose2d updateWithTime(
345      double currentTimeSeconds,
346      Rotation2d gyroAngle,
347      DifferentialDriveWheelSpeeds wheelVelocitiesMetersPerSecond,
348      double distanceLeftMeters,
349      double distanceRightMeters) {
350    double dt = m_prevTimeSeconds >= 0 ? currentTimeSeconds - m_prevTimeSeconds : m_nominalDt;
351    m_prevTimeSeconds = currentTimeSeconds;
352
353    var angle = gyroAngle.plus(m_gyroOffset);
354    // Diff drive forward kinematics:
355    // v_c = (v_l + v_r) / 2
356    var wheelVels = wheelVelocitiesMetersPerSecond;
357    var u =
358        VecBuilder.fill(
359            (wheelVels.leftMetersPerSecond + wheelVels.rightMetersPerSecond) / 2,
360            0,
361            angle.minus(m_previousAngle).getRadians() / dt);
362    m_previousAngle = angle;
363
364    var localY = VecBuilder.fill(distanceLeftMeters, distanceRightMeters, angle.getRadians());
365    m_poseBuffer.addSample(currentTimeSeconds, getEstimatedPosition());
366    m_observer.predict(u, dt);
367    m_observer.correct(u, localY);
368
369    return getEstimatedPosition();
370  }
371
372  private static Matrix<N5, N1> fillStateVector(Pose2d pose, double leftDist, double rightDist) {
373    return VecBuilder.fill(
374        pose.getTranslation().getX(),
375        pose.getTranslation().getY(),
376        pose.getRotation().getRadians(),
377        leftDist,
378        rightDist);
379  }
380}
